meanings.definition: To remove a stain or discoloration from something.
meanings.sent1: She used a special cleaner to destain the carpet.
meanings.sent2: I need to destain this shirt before the stain sets in.
meanings.sent3: After a clumsy spill, she quickly destained the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped destain the sidewalk, washing away the dirt.
meanings.sent5: He scrubbed hard to destain the old coffee mug.

meanings.sent1: The purification ritual aims to destain the soul.
meanings.sent2: She believed the waterfall had the power to destain her spirit.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the magical potion could destain any impurity.
meanings.sent4: The fresh air seemed to destain his mind, clearing away the doubts.
meanings.sent5: The act of forgiveness can destain even the deepest grudges.
